Participants.evidence: Patients with stage cT2N0 rectal adenocarcinomas

Intervention.evidence: treated with an oxaliplatin/capecitabine-based chemoradiation regimen followed by local excision

Objective.evidence: Objective: Prospectively assess anorectal function and health-related quality of life

Method_Outcome.evidence: assessed at enrollment and 1 year postoperatively

Number_Randomised.evidence: Seventy-one (98%) patients were evaluated at enrollment and 66 (92%) at 1 year

Number_Analysed.evidence: Seventy-one (98%) patients were evaluated at enrollment and 66 (92%) at 1 year

Result_Outcome.evidence: Fecal Incontinence Quality of Life results were significantly worse in the lifestyle (p<0.001), coping/behavior (p<0.001) and embarrassment (p=0.002) domains
